abstract: New York State Board of Regents committee decides that teachers will be banned from grading their own students' state standardized tests, part of effort to curtail cheating.
snippet: Teachers in New York State will soon be banned from grading their own students’ state standardized tests, a Board of Regents committee decided on Monday, part of an effort to curtail cheating.
lead_paragraph: Teachers in New York State will soon be banned from grading their own students’ state standardized tests, a Board of Regents committee decided on Monday, part of an effort to curtail cheating.

headline.main: Regents Set to Alter Rules for Grading State Exams
headline.print_headline: Regents Set To Alter Rules For Grading State Exams
